fields.title: Health and life expectancies
fields.description: Comparisons and inequalities in healthy life expectancies (HLE), disability-free life expectancies (DFLE) and life expectancies (LE).

fields.title: Transparency and governance
fields.description: We are working towards releasing more information about our organisation, to improve the transparency and accountability of government. We publish details of our structure and spending, and you can make a Freedom of Information request for other information.

fields.title: Business services
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: International migration
fields.description: People moving into and out of the UK, long term migration, short term migration, and visitor data providing a picture of those entering and leaving the UK, covering all lengths of stay. All data published from the Centre for International Migration

fields.title: Economy
fields.description: UK economic activity covering production, distribution, consumption and trade of goods and services. Individuals, businesses, organisations and governments all affect the development of the economy.

fields.title: Construction industry
fields.description: Construction of new buildings and repairs or alterations to existing properties in Great Britain measured by the amount charged for the work, including work by civil engineering companies.

fields.title: Find studies about people, families, and households
fields.description: Whether you have been invited to take part, or are just curious, find out more about our household studies and what is involved.

fields.title: Social care
fields.description: People who require social care, as well as those who work in social care, performance levels, and its financial cost.

fields.title: Families
fields.description: The composition of families and households, including data on lone parents, married couples and civil partnership families. Household size and household types, including people living alone, multi-family households and households where members are all unrelated are also provided.

fields.title: Data protection
fields.description: Privacy information

fields.title: Sexuality
fields.description: People's self identified sexual orientation, from Census 2021 data and the Annual Population survey.

fields.title: Balance of payments
fields.description: All economic transactions between residents of the UK and the rest of the world.

fields.title: Taxes and revenue
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: Causes of death
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: People in work
fields.description: Employment data covering employment rates, hours of work, claimants and earnings.

fields.title: Drug use, alcohol and smoking
fields.description: Smoking and drinking habits in Great Britain, deaths related to drug poisoning  and drug misuse, and deaths caused by diseases known to be related to alcohol consumption.

fields.title: Household characteristics
fields.description: The composition of households, including those who live alone, overcrowding and under-occupation, as well as internet and social media usage by household.

fields.title: Unemployment
fields.description: The level and rate of UK unemployment measured by the Labour Force Survey (LFS), using the International Labour Organisation's definition of unemployment.

fields.title: Population and migration
fields.description: Size, age, sex and geographic distribution of the UK population, and changes in the UK population and the factors driving these changes. These statistics have a wide range of uses. Central government, local government and the health sector use them for planning, resource allocation and managing the economy. They are also used by people such as market researchers and academics.

fields.title: Education and childcare
fields.description: Early years childcare, school and college education, and higher education and adult learning, including qualifications, personnel, and safety and well-being.

fields.title: Measuring progress, well-being and beyond GDP
fields.description: Societal and personal well-being in the UK looking beyond what we produce, to areas such as health, relationships, education and skills, what we do, where we live, our finances and the environment. This data comes from a variety of sources and much of the analysis is new.

fields.title: Economic output and productivity
fields.description: Manufacturing, production and services indices (measuring total economic output) and productivity (measuring efficiency, expressed as a ratio of output to input over a given period of time, for example output per person per hour).

fields.title: Services we offer
fields.description: We provide a number of services. Some of these services are free and others you can pay to use

fields.title: Personal and household finances
fields.description: Earnings and household spending, including household and personal debt, expenditure, and income and wealth. These statistics help build a picture of our spending and saving decisions.

fields.title: Crime and justice
fields.description: Crimes committed and the victims' characteristics, sourced from crimes recorded by the police and from the Crime Survey for England and Wales (CSEW). The outcomes of crime in terms of what happened to the offender are also included.

fields.title: Regional accounts
fields.description: Accounts for regions, sub-regions and local areas of the UK. These accounts allow comparisons between regions and against a UK average. Statistics include regional gross value added (GVA) and figures on regional gross disposable household income (GDHI).

fields.title: National accounts
fields.description: Core accounts for the UK economy as a whole; individual sectors (sector accounts); accounts for the regions, subregions and local areas of the UK; and satellite accounts that cover activities linked to the economy. The national accounts framework brings units and transactions together to provide a simple and understandable description of production, income, consumption, accumulation and wealth.

fields.title: COVID-19 Infection Surveillance Digital (CISD) Advisory Board
fields.description: The CISD Advisory Board makes scientific and analytical recommendations to the ONS.

fields.title: Studies about people, families and households
Live births
fields.description: Live births by age of mother/father, sex, marital status, country of birth, socio-economic status, previous children and area.

fields.title: Religion
fields.description: Analyses include people affiliating with a religion in the 2011 census, and religions among the non-UK born population in England and Wales.

fields.title: Deaths
fields.description: Deaths broken down by age, sex, area and cause of death.

fields.title: Environmental accounts
fields.description: Environmental accounts show how the environment contributes to the economy (for example, through the extraction of raw materials), the impacts that the economy has on the environment (for example, energy consumption and air emissions), and how society responds to environmental issues (for example, through taxation and expenditure on environmental protection).

fields.title: Declarations
fields.description: We aim to be transparent, and to do this we publish information about business expenses, hospitality received and office energy use.

fields.title: Health and social care
fields.description: Life expectancy and the impact of factors such as occupation, illness and drug misuse. We collect these statistics from registrations and surveys.

fields.title: Retail industry
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: Out of work benefits
fields.description: Claimants of unemployment related benefits including Employment and Support Allowance and other incapacity benefits, and Income Support and Pension Credit.

fields.title: Programmes and projects
fields.description: We run major programmes designed to deliver new statistics, improve our IT infrastructure, improve access to our data and develop our staff. These form part of our priorities for the next 5 years.

fields.title: Supply and use tables
fields.description: Balances showing the relationship between components of value added, industry inputs and outputs, and product supply and demand. These tables are a source for the data underlying Gross Domestic Product.

fields.title: Education
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the education level of people in England and Wales, and how it varies by age, sex, area, ethnicity, disability and other characteristics.

fields.title: Public sector finance
fields.description: UK public sector spending, tax revenues and investments, including government debt and deficit (the gap between revenue and spending) and data submitted to the European Commission.

fields.title: Mental health
fields.description: People who require social care, as well as those who work in social care, performance levels, and its financial cost.

fields.title: Housing
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the types of housing people live in, in England and Wales, including how it has changed over time, by area and household and property characteristics.

fields.title: Satellite accounts
fields.description: Accounts that cover activities linked to the economy but not part of the core UK national accounts including environmental accounts, tourism satellite account, and household satellite accounts.

fields.title: Health, disability and unpaid care
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand health, disability and unpaid care for people in England and Wales, and how it varies by areas and other characteristics.

fields.title: Workplace pensions
fields.description: Pensions linked to a person's workplace, including defined ambition (DA), defined benefit (DB) and defined contribution (DC) schemes.

fields.title: Tourism industry
fields.description: Tourism and travel (including accommodation services, food and beverage services, passenger transport services, vehicle hire, travel agencies and sports, recreational and conference services), employment levels and output of the tourism industry, the number of visitors to the UK and the amount they spend.

fields.title: Disability
fields.description: Analysis exploring the lives of disabled people in the UK, to understand disparities and investigate causalities.

fields.title: People not in work
fields.description: Unemployed and economically inactive people in the UK including claimants of out-of-work benefits and the number of redundancies.

fields.title: Leisure and tourism
fields.description: Visits and visitors to the UK, the reasons for visiting and the amount of money they spent here. Also UK residents travelling abroad, their reasons for travel and the amount of money they spent. The statistics on UK residents travelling abroad are an informal indicator of living standards.

fields.title: Public services productivity
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: Population projections
fields.description: Population projections provide an indication of the future size and age structure of the population based on mid-year population estimates and a set of assumptions of future fertility, mortality and migration. Available for the UK and its constituent countries as national population projections and for the regions, local authorities and clinical commissioning groups in England as subnational population projections. These projections are widely used for resource allocation and planning.

fields.title: Home internet and social media usage
fields.description: Use of the internet and social media and how long we use it for. These data include the number of people who have used the internet, those who use the internet frequently and those who have never used the internet. Most of these statistics are broken down by age and gender.

fields.title: Electoral registration
fields.description: Annual counts of people listed on electoral registers for the UK and its constituent countries, local government areas and parliamentary constituencies. These figures are based on people registered to vote not people eligible to vote.

fields.title: Productivity measures
fields.description: Economic productivity measures, including output per hour, output per job and output per worker for the whole economy and a range of industries; productivity in the public sector; and international comparisons of productivity across the G7 nations.

fields.title: Business births, deaths and survival rates
fields.description: Demography of UK businesses: active businesses, new registrations for VAT and PAYE (births), cessation of trading (deaths), and duration of trading (survival rates).

fields.title: Stillbirths
fields.description: Stillbirths containing data on cause of death and sex, plus analyses by some of the key risk factors affecting stillbirths, including age of mother and birthweight.

fields.title: Cultural identity
fields.description: How people in the UK see themselves today in terms of ethnicity, sexual identity, religion and language, and how this has changed over time. We use a diverse range of sources for this data.

fields.title: Inflation and price indices
fields.description: The rate of increase in prices for goods and services. Measures of inflation and prices include consumer price inflation, producer price inflation, the house price index, index of private housing rental prices, and construction output price indices.

fields.title: Health care system
fields.description: Expenditure on both private and public health care systems in the UK, as well as the results for the National Survey of Bereaved People (VOICES).

fields.title: Labour market
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the labour market for people in England and Wales, including how it varies by area and other characteristics.

fields.title: Business
fields.description: UK businesses registered for VAT and PAYE with regional breakdowns, including data on size (employment and turnover) and activity (type of industry), research and development, and business services.

fields.title: Mergers and acquisitions
fields.description: Business mergers and acquisitions involving UK companies, including de-mergers and disposals, where the transaction value is £1 million or more.

fields.title: Divorce
fields.description: Divorces taking place covering dissolutions and annulments of marriage by previous marital status, sex and age of persons divorcing, children of  divorced couples, fact proven at divorce and to whom granted.

fields.title: Changes to business
fields.description: UK business growth, survival and change over time. These figures are an informal indicator of confidence in the UK economy.

fields.title: Population estimates
fields.description: Annual population estimates for the UK and its constituent countries, the regions and counties of England, and local authorities and their equivalents. Estimates for lower and middle layer Super Output Areas, Westminster parliamentary constituencies, electoral wards and National Parks in England and Wales and clinical commissioning groups in England.

fields.title: Housing
fields.description: Property price, private rent and household survey and census statistics, used by government and other organisations for the creation and fulfilment of housing policy in the UK.

fields.title: International trade
fields.description: Trade in goods and services across the UK's international borders, including total imports and exports, the types of goods and services traded and general trends in international trade.

fields.title: Employment and labour market
fields.description: People in and out of work covering employment, unemployment, types of work, earnings, working patterns and workplace disputes.

fields.title: Data Strategy
fields.description: How we use and manage data while providing the best standard of statistical information for the public.

fields.title: Marriage, cohabitation and civil partnerships
fields.description: Marriages formed, civil partnerships formed and dissolved, and estimates of the population by marital status and living arrangements.

fields.title: Expenditure
fields.description: Spending patterns of UK households, with findings taken from the Living Costs and Food Survey (LCF).

fields.title: ONS Evaluation Strategy
fields.description: The ONS’s vision for evaluation, embedding best practice and supporting evaluations across government through the Analysis Function and Integrated Data Service.

fields.title: Language
fields.description: The proportion of adults using English as their main language and a breakdown of other languages used in the UK.

fields.title: Health inequalities
fields.description: Current patterns and trends in ill health and death by measures of socio-economic status.

fields.title: Child health
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: Information for businesses
fields.description: If you have received a survey from us asking you to take part, you can find more information about what is involved and how we will use your response by going to the list of business surveys pages.

fields.title: Debt
fields.description: Debt of UK households, broken down by financial debt and property debt.

fields.title: Health and well-being
fields.description: Analyses of social and economic data from government and other organisations to paint a picture of UK society and how it changes, including comparisons with other countries.

fields.title: Income and wealth
fields.description: UK households income and wealth.

fields.title: Workplace disputes and working conditions
fields.description: Work stoppages because of disputes between employers and employees. Includes strikes and lock-outs, number of days lost in the public and private sectors, and number of workers involved.

fields.title: Output
fields.description: Economic output and activity of the UK. Includes manufacturing, production and services, and other measures of economic activity.

fields.title: Demography
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the population of England and Wales, including age, sex, household composition and legal partnerships.

fields.title: Labour productivity
fields.description: Efficiency of the UK workforce, including output per worker, per job and per hour. Data are available by industry and by region.

fields.title: Public sector personnel
fields.description: People employed in central and local government, and public corporations, including second jobs in the public sector. Includes Civil Service employment with regional and diversity analyses.

fields.title: How we collect and use data at the ONS
fields.description: Find out more about our Data Strategy and the way we work, as well as our plans for transforming the way we collect and process data.

fields.title: Life expectancies
fields.description: How long, on average, people can expect to live using estimates of the population and the number of deaths.

fields.title: Sexual orientation and gender identity
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the sexual orientation and gender identity of people in England and Wales, including how it varies by area and characteristics such as demography, housing, employment and education.

fields.title: Office for National Statistics Government Major Projects Portfolio data
Births, deaths and marriages
fields.description: Life events in the UK including fertility rates, live births and stillbirths, family composition, life expectancy and deaths. This tells us about the health and relationships of the population.

fields.title: Investments, pensions and trusts
fields.description: Net flows of investment into the UK, the number of people who hold pensions of different types, and investments made by various types of trusts.

fields.title: People's attitudes to data
fields.description: Find out what people think about sharing their data and how data are used

fields.title: Equalities
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand equality for people in England and Wales, including what life is like for people with certain characteristics.

fields.title: Armed forces community
fields.description: Information about the armed forces community, including those who have previously served in the armed forces (veterans) and their families, to help support the Armed Forces Covenant.

fields.title: UK armed forces veterans
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the veteran population of England and Wales, including topics such as housing, education, employment and skills.

fields.title: Gross Value Added (GVA)
fields.description: Regional gross value added using production (GVA(P)) and income (GVA(I)) approaches. Regional gross value added is the value generated by any unit engaged in the production of goods and services. GVA per head is a useful way of comparing regions of different sizes. It is not, however, a measure of regional productivity.

fields.title: Innovative research and collaborations
fields.description: Our innovative research, how we collaborate with other organisations and our strategy.

fields.title: Redundancies
fields.description: People who have been made redundant or have taken voluntary redundancy.

fields.title: Ageing
fields.description: Estimates of those aged 90 years and over in the UK, including what determines life expectancy and indicators of the health of the very old. These statistics help us understand the needs of an ageing population.

fields.title: Activity, size and location
fields.description: UK businesses broken down by location, industry, legal status and employment, and UK enterprise levels measured by turnover.

fields.title: Examples of how data and statistics benefit you
fields.description: See how organisations use our statistics to make important decisions that affect us all.

fields.title: Freedom of Information (FOI)
fields.description: You can ask us for all of the information we have on any subject you choose.

fields.title: International migration
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand people who have moved in and out of the UK within England and Wales, including changes over time, people with more than one passport and second-generation migration.

fields.title: Census
fields.description: Census

fields.title: UK sector accounts
fields.description: Transactions of particular groups of institutions (sectors) within the UK economy, showing how the income from production is distributed and redistributed and how savings are used to add wealth through investment in physical or financial assets.

fields.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19)
fields.description: Latest data and analysis on coronavirus (COVID-19) in the UK and its effect on the economy and society.

fields.title: Research and development expenditure
fields.description: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.

fields.title: Keeping data safe and protecting your personal information
fields.description: The safety of your information is our top priority. Learn more about how we keep data secure and confidential.

fields.title: Public spending
fields.description: We look at what the UK government spends on the general public, such as pensions, provisions, and infrastructure.

fields.title: Migration within the UK
fields.description: Residential moves between different geographic areas within the UK sourced from the NHS Patient Register, the NHS Central Register (NHSCR) and the Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA).

fields.title: IT and internet industry
fields.description: Internet sales by businesses in the UK (total value and as a percentage of all retail sales) and the percentage of businesses that have a website and broadband connection. These figures indicate the importance of the internet to UK businesses.

fields.title: Manufacturing and production industry
fields.description: UK manufacturing and other production industries (such as mining and quarrying, energy supply, water supply and waste management), including total UK production output, and UK manufactures' sales by product and industrial division, with EU comparisons.

fields.title: Historic census
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand how life has changed over time, using data from the 2011 Census and earlier.

fields.title: Ethnicity
fields.description: Analyses include ethnic identities among the non-UK born population in England and Wales, labour market participation, trends in general health and unpaid care by ethnic group, and inter-ethnic relationships.

fields.title: Earnings and working hours
fields.description: Average weekly earnings of people in the UK and information on the gender pay gap and low pay. Data from Average Weekly Earnings (AWE) and the Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE).

fields.title: Economic inactivity
fields.description: People not in employment who have not been seeking work within the last 4 weeks and/or are unable to start work within the next 2 weeks.

fields.title: Business innovation
fields.description: Research and development in the UK carried out or funded by business enterprises, higher education, government (including research councils) and private non-profit organisations.

fields.title: Employment and employee types
fields.description: Employment rates show the number of people in paid work as a proportion of the population, broken down by age and sex. Includes information on the number of people in employment and vacancies.

fields.title: Learning about data
fields.description: Learn more about data and statistics through our education programme, videos and partnerships​

fields.title: Gender identity
fields.description: Information about people’s gender identity from Census 2021.

fields.title: Conception and fertility rates
fields.description: Childbearing, conceptions, births and abortions in the UK. These statistics inform us about average family size and maternity trends among women, by age and area.

fields.title: Elections
fields.description: ** no description **

fields.title: Pensions, savings and investments
fields.description: State, private, occupational and workplace pensions, including pension trends that draws together data from other government departments and organisations.

fields.title: Ethnic group, national identity, language and religion
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand people's ethnicity, national identity, language and religion in England and Wales, including changes over time and Welsh language.

fields.title: People, population and community
fields.description: People living in the UK, changes in the population, how we spend our money, and data on crime, relationships, health and religion. These statistics help us build a detailed picture of how we live.

fields.title: What we do
fields.description: Our main responsibilities are collecting, analysing and disseminating statistics about the UK's economy, society and population.

fields.title: Business, industry and trade
fields.description: Activities of businesses and industry in the UK, including data on the production and trade of goods and services, sales by retailers, characteristics of businesses, the construction and manufacturing sectors, and international trade.

fields.title: Statistics
fields.description: Our range of economic, social and population statistics are published in over 600 releases a year. As well as these, you can request extra information from us on topics of your choice, or see the information others have already requested. We also publish our 'publication scheme' to show all of the information that we make public. If you’d like to get involved in our work, you can find information about this in the consultations and surveys section.

fields.title: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
fields.description: Estimates of GDP are released on a monthly and quarterly basis. Monthly estimates are released alongside other short-term economic indicators. The two quarterly estimates contain data from all three approaches to measuring GDP and are called the First quarterly estimate of GDP and the Quarterly National Accounts. Data sources feeding into the two types of releases are consistent with each other.

fields.title: Travel to work
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand how people in England and Wales travel to work, including mode of transport, distance and how it changes across rural and urban areas.

fields.title: Ageing
fields.description: Facts and figures to help understand the needs of an ageing population in England and Wales including changes over time and the characteristics of certain age groups.

fields.title: Government, public sector and taxes
fields.description: Public sector spending, tax revenues and investments for the UK, including government debt and deficit (the gap between revenue and spending), research and development, and the effect of taxes.

fields.title: Gross disposable household income
fields.description: The amount of money that that all of the individuals in the household sector have available for spending or saving after income distribution measures (for example, taxes, social contributions and benefits) have taken effect. GDHI does not provide measures relating to actual households or family units. The figures cover regions, sub-regions and local areas of the UK.

fields.title: Using public data to produce statistics
fields.description: We collect and process your data safely and securely to publish statistics that benefit us all.
